description.question: A block of mass $m_1$ rests on an incline of angle $\theta = 20^\circ$. The coefficients of static and kinetic friction are $\mu_s = 0.8$ and $\mu_k = 0.5$. It is connected via a massless string over a massless and frictionless pulley. Block $m_2$ has mass 2 kg. If $m_1 = 1.5kg$, what's the magnitude of the acceleration of the $m_2$ in (in m/s^2)?

solution.section_title: Compute the magnitudes of the primary forces

solution.description: Since $F_2 > F_1$, the friction force acts against $F_2$.

solution.section_title: Sum forces and form equation for acceleration
solution.description:
$\Sigma F = ma = F_{net}$  

 $a = \dfrac{F_{net}}{m_1 + m_2} = \dfrac{-m_1 g \cos\theta \;\mu_k - m_1 g \sin\theta + m_2 g}{m_1 + m_2}$

$m_1 =$ mass Block 1  
 $m_2 =$ mass Block 2  
 $g =$ gravity  
 $\mu_k =$ kinetic friction coefficient
